qas.question: What did the island have an abundance of when discovered?
What was imported by the settlers of the island?
What kind of buildings were built by the settlers?

answers.text: a chapel and one or two houses.

qas.question: Who was left on the island to recover when sick?
What was the island a source of for ships travelling from Asia to Europe?

context: The Portuguese found the island uninhabited, with an abundance of <a0_0>trees and fresh water.<a0_0/> They imported <a1_0>livestock, fruit trees and vegetables<a1_0/>, and built <a2_0>a chapel and one or two houses.<a2_0/> Though they formed no permanent settlement, the island was an important rendezvous point and source of <a4_0>food<a4_0/> for ships travelling from Asia to Europe, and frequently sick <a3_0>mariners<a3_0/> were left on the island to recover, before taking passage on the next ship to call on the island.
